metadata.title: CVE-2024-0584 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - high
metadata.description:
A use-after-free issue was found in igmp_start_timer in net/ipv4/igmp.c inthe network sub-component in the Linux Kernel. This flaw allows a localuser to observe a refcnt use-after-free issue when receiving an igmp querypacket, leading to a kernel information leak.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-0584` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-92-generic - 5.15.0-92.102
linux-image-5.15.0-92-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-92.102
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-92-generic - 5.15.0-92.102
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-92-generic-64k - 5.15.0-92.102
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1049-kvm - 5.15.0-1049.54
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1052-aws - 5.15.0-1052.57
No subscription required

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '5.15.0-92.102').
linux-hwe-5.19: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-hwe-6.2').
